uint32_t  sock_buf_depth,
uint8_t  rtcp_dscp_value,
uint8_t  rtcp_rsize,
vqec_chan_t *  parent_chan 
)

Function: rtp_create_session_era_recv Description: Create the session structure for an RTP/RTCP session for era_recv environment. Parameters:

Parameters:
[in] src_addr - sessions src address to use for transmitting packets.
[in] p_cname - name
[in] era_dest_addr - destination address of primary session
[in] recv_rtcp_port - Client port on which RTCP packets are recvd. May be zero to disable RTCP reception.
[in] send_rtcp_port - Server port to which RTCP packets are sent. May be zero to disable RTCP transmission.
[in] fbt_ip_addr - ip address of feedback target
[in] rtcp_bw_cfg - ptr to RTCP bandwidth config info
[in] rtcp_xr_cfg - ptr to RTCP XR config info
[in] orig_source_addr - Original primary stream's source address.
[in] orig_source_port - Original primary stream's source port.
[in] sock_buf_depth - The rx socket buffer depth to be used.
[in] rtcp_dscp_value - DSCP value to use for RTCP packets sent
[in] rtcp_rsize - Reduced size RTCP setting for this session
[in] parent_chan - Pointer to parent channel.
Returns:
pointer to rtp_era_recv_t session that is allocated, or NULL on failure.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------- Send a NAK-PLI to start a RCC burst.

Parameters:
[in] p_session Pointer to the primary session.
[in] rcc_min_fill RCC minimum fill TLV value.
[in] rcc_max_fill RCC maximum fill TLV value.
[in] do_fast_fill Specifies whether or not to do a fast-fill RCC.
[in] maximum_recv_bw Amount of receive bandwidth that is available for the RCC operation.
[in] max_fastfill Maximum amount of data that can be fast-filled.
[out] boolean Returns true if the NAK-PLI message is enqueued successfully on the tx socket. ---------------------------------------------------------------------------

Parameters:
[in] p_session Pointer to the primary session.
[in] remote_addr IP address to which the packet is sent.
[in] remote_port UDP port to which the packet is sent.
[in] buf Pointer to the packet contents.
[in] len Length of the contents.
[out] boolean Returns true if the packet was successfully enQd in the socket. ---------------------------------------------------------------------------

static boolean rtp_era_update_pktflow_src ( rtp_era_recv_t *  p_session,
vqec_dp_rtp_src_table_t *  p_table 
) [static]

--------------------------------------------------------------------------- Update the pktflow source on the primary session. This method is invoked if the session is in the active or inactive states.

Parameters:
[in] session Pointer to the primary session.
[in] p_table Pointer to the dataplane RTP source table.
[out] boolean Returns true if the existing packetflow source is not changed (including null source), or a new packetflow source is elected. ---------------------------------------------------------------------------

static void rtp_era_update_receiver_stats ( rtp_session_t *  p_sess,
rtp_member_t *  p_source,
boolean  reset_xr_stats 
) [static]

--------------------------------------------------------------------------- Update RTP receiver statistics of an ERA session for a given remote sender.

If XR stats are configured for the session and were successfully updated, they will be referenced in these locations: p_era_recv_source->xr_stats p_era_recv_source->post_er_stats If XR stats are not configured for the session (or could not be updated), then the above fields will be NULL.

Parameters:
[in] p_session Pointer to the ERA session.
[in] p_source Pointer to the per-member data for a remote source.
[in] reset_xr_stats True if XR stats should be reset. If this is set to TRUE, and RTCP XR is enabled on the session, then the XR stats will be collected from the DP and stored in the session structure (with a pointer to it being stored in the source structure). ---------------------------------------------------------------------------

static void rtp_era_update_receiver_xr_dc_stats ( rtp_era_recv_t *  p_era_sess  )  [static]

-------------------------------------------------------------------------- Update RTP Diagnostic Counter statistics in the channel's control plane cache.

Parameters:
[in] p_session Pointer to the ERA session. ---------------------------------------------------------------------------

static void rtp_era_update_receiver_xr_ma_stats ( rtp_era_recv_t *  p_era_sess  )  [static]

--------------------------------------------------------------------------- Update RTP multicast acquisition statistics in the channel's control plane cache.

Parameters:
[in] p_session Pointer to the ERA session. ---------------------------------------------------------------------------

static void rtp_era_update_stats ( rtp_session_t *  p_sess,
boolean  reset_xr_stats 
) [static]

--------------------------------------------------------------------------- Update RTP statistics of an ERA session. This updates receiver stats for the session which are independent of the remote sender. Stats that are specific to a remote sender are updated in the "rtp_update_receiver_stats" method.

Parameters:
[in] p_session Pointer to the ERA session.
[in] reset_xr_stats [ignored] Caller should set to TRUE ---------------------------------------------------------------------------

Function: rtp_update_session_era_recv Description: Updates the session structure for an RTP/RTCP session for era_recv environment. Parameters:

Parameters:
[in] p_era_recv session to be updated
[in] fbt_ip_addr ip address of feedback target
[in] send_rtcp_port server port to which RTCP packets are sent.
[out] boolean TRUE upon successful update, FALSE upon failure
